title: Understanding Compassion Fatigue
text: Compassion fatigue is a condition that affects individuals who are exposed to the suffering of others over a prolonged period. It is often seen in healthcare professionals, such as nurses, who regularly deal with patients experiencing trauma or loss.

title: Symptoms of Compassion Fatigue
text: Common symptoms of compassion fatigue include emotional exhaustion, reduced empathy, and a sense of detachment from others. It can lead to burnout if not addressed.

hintAnswer: a decreased capacity for empathy over time due to repeated exposure to traumatic events or losses
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes compassion fatigue?
choices: a common, not necessarily unhealthy, side effect of grief, marked by a sense of pulling away from others and the world
a deep internalization of the grieving process
when social networks change after a loss. The bereaved may feel alienated or detached from their usual social groups due to the shared history and memories with the deceased
a decreased capacity for empathy over time due to repeated exposure to traumatic events or losses
